title.narrative: FIELD AND HUMANITARIAN ACTION COORDINATION

description.narrative: The management and accountability of field operations and humanitarian action coordination are improved., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is effectively designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The management and accountability of field operations and humanitarian action coordination are improved.

description.narrative: Based on programme and PBR 2020 staffing needs and aligned with the accountability framework, zonal Office capacities and responsibilities have continued to be strengthened with the swift recruitment in 2021 of 33 staffs both in programme and operations to deliver key programmatic results for children in humanitarian situations, whilst ensuring a safe and conducive working environment for UNICEF staff.UNICEF maintained its strong partnerships with governments and CSOs for programme implementation in line with UNICEF core values and humanitarian principles with emphasis on localization, strengthening of humanitarian and development programme linkages, multisectoral and integrated programming, and geographic convergence.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
